page.title: 14LIBRARY
page.content: We went to the Welcombe Avenue Public Library for visit. Most of the people who go there are from Braunstone. In the library, there are 13,116 books.Leicestershire County Council owns the building and all of the books are paid for by the ratepayers. There are 3 library assistants, 1 cleaner and the librarian come once per week. In a half hour survey, 2 ladies, two men and a small boy came in to the library to choose books. You can have up to 4 tickets and this will allow you to borrow up to 4 books. If you choose a book, the lady at the desk takes out the ticket and stmps the book with the date on which it is due back, which is 3 weeks. If you are late in returning your books, you must pay a fine of 1p per book per day. It is always warm and quiet in the library which was built in 1964.
